messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. I'm now focusing on endpoint `/v1/posts/{post}` with method PATCH, and here is the relevant information I found:

1. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php`, `PostController` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/v1/posts/{post}` with HTTP method PATCH.

2. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php`, `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostController@update` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/v1/posts/{post}` with HTTP method PATCH.

3. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php`, `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostController@destroy` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/v1/posts/{post}` with HTTP method PATCH.

4. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php`, `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostController@show` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/v1/posts/{post}` with HTTP method PATCH.

I'll provide you with the contents of the files mentioned above, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to generate a list of Parameter Objects (the value of paths.[endpoint].[method].parameters) in Swagger 2.0 format.

You need to think step by step and provide an explanation of your results first. Then, output exactly "the final generated result begins", followed by the list of Parameter Objects in JSON format. Do not include fields not mentioned above, and do not use references ($ref) in your output (try to obtain the structure by executing additional Unix commands).

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Explanation and reasoning

I inspected the controller and request validation to determine what parameters the PATCH /v1/posts/{post} endpoint expects:

- Route and controller
  - routes/api.php registers an apiResource for posts and the authenticated group includes update => the update action (PATCH /v1/posts/{post}) is handled by App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostController::update.
  - The controller method signature is update(PostsRequest $request, Post $post). Route model binding uses the Post model.

- Route key
  - The Post model overrides getRouteKeyName() to return 'id' for JSON requests. Since this is an API route, the path parameter {post} is the post id (an integer).

- Request body
  - The update action uses PostsRequest. Its rules() define the validation rules used for the request payload:
    - title: required (string)
    - content: required (string)
    - posted_at: required|date (string in date/datetime format)
    - author_id: required|exists:users,id (integer)
    - thumbnail_id: nullable|exists:media,id (integer or null)
  - The controller update() calls $post->update($request->only(['title', 'content', 'posted_at', 'author_id', 'thumbnail_id'])), so those are the fields used by the endpoint. Although PostsRequest also prepares/merges a slug, update() does not use slug, so slug is omitted from the request body schema.

- Swagger 2.0 Parameter objects to include
  - A path parameter named "post", required, integer (post id).
  - A single body parameter (in: body) named "body", required, with a JSON object schema describing the properties title, content, posted_at, author_id, thumbnail_id. According to the PostsRequest rules, title, content, posted_at, and author_id are required in the request body; thumbnail_id is optional (nullable).

The final generated result begins
[
  {
    "name": "post",
    "in": "path",
    "required": true,
    "type": "integer",
    "format": "int64",
    "description": "ID of the post (route model binding uses the post id for API requests)."
  },
  {
    "name": "body",
    "in": "body",
    "required": true,
    "description": "Post attributes to update.",
    "schema": {
      "type": "object",
      "properties": {
        "title": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "Post title"
        },
        "content": {
          "type": "string",
          "description": "Post content/body"
        },
        "posted_at": {
          "type": "string",
          "format": "date-time",
          "description": "Publication date/time (ISO 8601)"
        },
        "author_id": {
          "type": "integer",
          "format": "int64",
          "description": "ID of the post author"
        },
        "thumbnail_id": {
          "type": "integer",
          "format": "int64",
          "description": "ID of the thumbnail media (nullable, optional)"
        }
      },
      "required": [
        "title",
        "content",
        "posted_at",
        "author_id"
      ]
    }
  }
]
